subject: Hockey, Ice
lead_paragraph: Alex Ovechkin became the first player in 12 years to score 60 goals in a season, but his focus Friday night was on the Washington Capitals’ victory that left them a point out of the final Eastern Conference playoff spot going into Saturday night’s game.“I just do my job; I don’t think about personal goals,” Ovechkin said after reaching the 60-goal mark with a pair in the Capitals’ 5-3 victory against the host Atlanta Thrashers.No one in the N.H.L. had hit the 60-goal mark since the 1995-96 season, when Pittsburgh’s Mario Lemieux and Jaromir Jagr both did it. Ovechkin’s previous best was 52 goals in his rookie season, 2005-6.
